conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and School_A is my first choice. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would commit to enrolling if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: As Student_B, my top true choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the only seat. I know School_A ranks me 4th, so acceptance is not guaranteed, but delaying would only reduce my chances if higher-priority students apply. I will emphasize fit and commitment to School_A to strengthen my application.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your thoughtful application and for ranking School_A as your first choice. After careful consideration, we are unable to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_B 4th (behind E, D, A). Student_B prefers School_A first, so accepting would immediately fill the seat, but it risks forgoing higher-priority students (E/D/A) who may apply later. Given we have full info: Student_E ranks School_A 3rd (after C,D), Student_D ranks School_A 3rd (after B,C), Student_A ranks School_A 3rd (after B,C). These higher-priority students are likely to apply first to their top choices (B/C/D) and may not reach School_A if accepted elsewhere, but we cannot be sure in round 1. Since we can only send one message per round and must decide now, the optimal strategy to maximize chance of matching with top priority is to reject lower-ranked Student_B now and keep capacity for E/D/A if they come later.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I would gladly commit if accepted. I’m especially excited about the academic environment and would be eager to contribute positively to the school community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I am ranked 3rd in School_B's priority list (behind Student_E and Student_B). Since capacities are 1, I need to signal strong commitment immediately to improve my chances if higher-priority students apply elsewhere. Therefore I will apply to School_B in round 1 with a clear first-choice message.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_B. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and received APPLY from Students C, A, and D. School_B’s true priority is E > B > C > D > A, so among current applicants Student_C is the highest-ranked. However, Student_E is School_B’s top choice and may still apply later; Student_E’s preferences rank School_B last, so unlikely to apply early, but could be unmatched later and potentially apply. Student_B (2nd on our list) currently prefers School_A first, so may not approach us this round. Given we must respond now to Student_C’s APPLY with accept/reject, accepting secures a relatively high-priority match (3rd). Rejecting risks ending with a worse match (D or A) or none, since E and B are not guaranteed. Therefore accept Student_C.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because your programs and environment are the best fit for my goals, and if admitted I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would not improve my position and could only reduce my chances if the seat is taken. I will still apply now and emphasize strong fit and commitment to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, our incoming class is full and we’re unable to extend an offer of admission. We appreciate you considering School_B and wish you the best in the remainder of the process. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (matched with Student_C) and remaining quota is 0. Per rules, we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of priority. Student_A is also lowest on our true priority list, so even if capacity opened later, they would not improve our current match.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I will submit a clear [APPLY] emphasizing fit and commitment to increase the chance they consider me if higher-ranked applicants do not apply or are matched elsewhere.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, our incoming class is full and we’re unable to extend an offer of admission. We appreciate you considering School_B and wish you the best in the remainder of the process. [REJECT]

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and School_C is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would commit to enrolling if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

I’m not the highest priority there (ranked behind B, C, D), so delaying could let higher-priority students take the only seat. conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

We appreciate your interest in School_C and wish you the best in the rest of the process.

In round 1, only Student_E has applied to me, but higher-priority students (especially Student_B and Student_C) both list School_C as their 3rd and 2nd choices respectively, and may apply later if rejected elsewhere. With quota 1, accepting Student_E now would block a potential match with a higher-priority student. Therefore I should reject now and keep the seat available for higher-priority candidates.

Although School_C ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still my best shot to secure a top feasible option before capacity fills. I will signal strong commitment and fit to maximize any chance if higher-priority students go elsewhere.

conversation.message:

Since Student_B is available and has applied with a stated commitment, accepting Student_A now would block a strictly better outcome. Therefore, reject Student_A to preserve capacity for Student_B (and, secondarily, Student_D).

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m writing to formally apply to School_C. Student_A is last on our list and has been rejected before; Student_D is acceptable but dominated by the opportunity to accept Student_B. Therefore reject D to preserve the seat for B.

Prior rejections of others don’t constrain us; we should accept immediately to lock in our top choice.
